name: Sahih al-Bukhari
author: Imam al-Bukhari
description: One of the most authentic collections of hadith in Sunni Islam, compiled by Muhammad ibn Ismail al-Bukhari.

name: Sahih Muslim
author: Muslim ibn al-Hajjaj
description: Considered the second most authentic hadith collection after Sahih al-Bukhari.

name: Sunan Abu Dawud
author: Abu Dawud al-Sijistani
description: Famous for its focus on legal rulings and fiqh-related narrations.

name: Jami‘ al-Tirmidhi
author: al-Tirmidhi
description: Includes commentary and classification of hadiths; popular for its analytical approach.

name: Sunan al-Nasa’i
author: al-Nasa’i
description: Highly regarded for its precision and methodology among the six major Sunni collections.

name: Sunan Ibn Majah
author: Ibn Majah
description: Contains many hadiths not found in other major collections, making it both valuable and debated.

name: Musnad Ahmad ibn Hanbal
author: Ahmad ibn Hanbal
description: A massive collection with over 30,000 hadiths organized by companion rather than topic.

name: Muwatta Malik
author: Malik ibn Anas
description: One of the earliest hadith collections, combining hadith with legal opinions of Medina scholars.

name: Sunan al-Darimi
author: al-Darimi
description: An early hadith collection with a more historical and biographical scope.
